SEARCH
Package com.rikuthin.managers

Class EnemyManager

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.managers.EnemyManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Updateable
public class EnemyManager extends Object implements Updateable
The EnemyManager is the primary service responsible for the **active lifecycle** of all enemies in the game.

This manager dictates enemy behavior by handling spawning (creation rules), entity updates (calling the Enemy.update() method on all active enemies), and cleanup (defining the criteria for enemy removal), delegating storage and mutation to the EnemyRepository.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemyManager

      public EnemyManager()
      Constructs the EnemyManager and retrieves the singleton instance of the EnemyRepository to establish its dependency. Initializes the manager for game start.

  • Method Details

    • isOnCreationCooldown

      public boolean isOnCreationCooldown()
      Checks if the enemy creation cooldown is currently active.
      Returns:
      true if the cooldown is active, otherwise false.

    • getEnemyCreationCooldownMs

      public long getEnemyCreationCooldownMs()
      Gets the required cooldown time in milliseconds between enemy creations.
      Returns:
      The cooldown time in millisecods.

    • getElapsedCreationCooldownMs

      public long getElapsedCreationCooldownMs()
      Returns how many milliseconds of the enemy creation cooldown have passed since the last enemy was created.
      Returns:
      The elasped time in milliseconds.

    • getLastUpdateTime

      public long getLastUpdateTime()
      Returns the system timestamp (in milliseconds) of the manager's last update() call.
      Returns:
      The last update time.

    • init

      public final void init()
      Initializes the EnemyManager for a new game.

      This method resets the random generator, clears the repository of old enemies, and resets all cooldown tracking variables.

    • canCreateEnemy

      public boolean canCreateEnemy()
      Checks if a new enemy can be created based on the maximum enemy count and the creation cooldown status.
      Returns:
      true if a new Enemy can be created, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • addEnemy

      public void addEnemy(Enemy enemy)
      Adds a specific, pre-built Enemy instance to the managed collection. The enemy is added only if creation is currently allowed by canCreateEnemy().
      Parameters:
      enemy - The new enemy instance to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • createRandomEnemy

      public void createRandomEnemy(Player player)
      Creates a new random Enemy (type and position) if allowed by canCreateEnemy() and adds it to the collection.

      After successful creation, the enemy cooldown is activated.

      Parameters:
      player - The Player entity that the newly created Enemy will target.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • update

      public void update()
      The primary game loop method. Updates the enemy system by:
      1. Tracking delta time for cooldowns.
      2. Attempting to create a new enemy.
      3. Calling the update logic for all active entities.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updateable
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.
